{{Infobox national football team | Name = India Under-16 | Flag = Flag of India.svg | Badge = India FA.svg | FIFA Trigramme = IND | Nickname = Blue Tigers | Association = [[All India Football Federation|AIFF]] | Confederation = [[Asian Football Confederation|AFC]] (Asia) | Coach = {{flagicon|IND}} Thomas Joseph | pattern_la1=_ind10h|pattern_b1=|pattern_ra1=_ind10h | leftarm1=0033FF|body1=0033FF|rightarm1=0033FF|shorts1=0033FF|socks1=0033FF| | pattern_la2=_ind10a|pattern_b2=|pattern_ra2=_ind10a | leftarm2=FF8F00|body2=FF8F00|rightarm2=FF8F00|shorts2=FF8F00|socks2=FF8F00 }} '''India national under-16 football team''', also known as [[India]] under-16s or India U16(s), represents [[India]] in [[association football]] at a under-16 age level and is controlled by the [[All India Football Federation]], the governing body for [[Football in India]]. The current manager is Thomas Joseph, who was appointed in July 2011. In the last few years, the [[All India Football Federation]] has been working hard for the development of the under-16 team. Top youth development expert and British coach Colin Toal has been given the job to plan out the strategies. The team was given extensive exposure before the previous Asian meet. It included trips to the United States and England to play a series of matches. In the US, India won most of their matches and in England, they held the [[Manchester United]] under-16 team to a draw. The team is given round the year extensive training at the Training Centre in [[Margao]], [[Goa]]. ==AFC Championships== ===1996 AFC Championships=== The potential of Indiaâs under-16 team was first realized in 1996 when the national team qualified for the final rounds of the [[1996 AFC U-17 Championship|Asian championships]]. The team didnât do well in the finals but a host of talented footballers emerged from this side at the national level. ===2008 AFC U-16 Championships=== In 2007, when India began their campaign in the [[2008 AFC U-16 Championship|AFC U-16 Championship]] in Dammam, Saudi Arabia, they took everyone by surprise with some stunning results. Apart from earning a creditable draw against favourites Iraq, the Indian boys made the nation proud by routing hosts Saudi Arabia and Lebanon to qualify for the final rounds in Uzbekistan. ===2012 AFC U-16 Championships qualification=== India have qualified for the 2012 AFC U-16 asian cup for the second time as 2nd placed team in the group along side Uzbekistan. ==South Asian Football Federation Championships== ===2011 SAFF U-16 Championships=== The India under-16 team is currently participating in the [[SAFF U-16 Championship]]. So far India failed to win there first match as they lost 1-0 to rivals [[Pakistan national football team|Pakistan]]. In there second match India managed though to make up for that defeat by winning 5-0 against [[Maldives national football team|Maldives]]. Then in the semi-finals India managed to beat [[Nepal national football team|Nepal]] 4-2 to move on to the Final against [[Pakistan national football team|Pakistan]], but lost that match 2-1. ==Fixtures and Results 2011== ===AFC U16 Qualifiers=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !width="175"|Team !width="20"|{{Tooltip| Pld | Played}} !width="20"|{{Tooltip| W | Won}} !width="20"|{{Tooltip| D | Drawn}} !width="20"|{{Tooltip| L | Lost}} !width="20"|{{Tooltip| GF | Goals for}} !width="20"|{{Tooltip| GA | Goals against}} !width="20"|{{Tooltip| GD | Goal difference}} !width="20"|{{Tooltip| Pts | Points}} |- bgcolor=ccffcc |align=left|{{fb|UZB}} |3||3||0||0||18||0||+18||'''9''' |- bgcolor=ccffcc |align=left|{{fb|IND}} |4||3||0||1||13||11||+2||'''9''' |- |align=left|{{fb|TJK}} |3||1||1||1||5||6||â1||'''4''' |- bgcolor=ffcccc |align=left|{{fb|BHR}} |3||0||1||2||3||6||â3||'''1''' |- bgcolor=ffcccc |align=left|{{fb|KGZ}} |3||0||0||3||0||16||â16||'''0''' |} {{footballbox collapsible |date = 1 October |time = 16:00 IST |team1 = {{flagicon|India}} India |team2 = {{flagicon|Kyrgyzstan}} [[Kyrgyzstan national under-16 football team|Kyrgyzstan]] |score = 7 - 0 |result = |goals1 = [[Uttam Rai|Rai]] {{goal|5||7||45||55||85}}
